page.title: 01Tan-y-Groes/Sarnau, Dyfed
page.content: An area in coastal mid-Wales, the major towns of{Cardigan}to the south and{Aberaeron}to the north. The district contains several small hamlets, and a few centres of small populations.{Tresaith, Tan-y-Groes and {Sarnau}are the major villages, each A small nucleus of housing with a general shop and possibly a post office or garage. {Employment}is mainly in{farming}and the{tourist {industry,}with some of the population travelling to the neighbouring towns. The area is sheltered by hills to the north-east and on the coast, resulting in a mild wet climate. The indigenous population is largely{welsh-speaking, welsh is still the main language in schools, but with an increasing number of{immigrants from England,}following emmigration by the welsh to the larger towns and England.
